s1.name: User Contributions
s1.subtitle: Are you using JavaService?
s1.p: If you make use of the JavaService utility, then why not share that information? Send an email to the javaservice team and describe what you are using it for. The more user stories that can be described for the software, then the better the likelihood of future enhancements, better shared support, and increased future take-up.

s1.name: Developer Contributions
s1.subtitle: Enhancements for JavaService
s1.p: If you have developed any improvements or new features to the JavaService C++ software, it would be greatly appreciated if you would share these with the greater Open Source community. Send in your updates and they will be considered for inclusion in subsequent releases, or made available for manual add-ins if desired.
s1.subtitle: JavaService Documentation
s1.p: Although the software itself is easy to use, any application can benefit from further documentation effort to describe configuration, usage and frequently-asked-questions. Any input on this front will be appreciated.
s1.subtitle: Test Tools
s1.p: As some people do experience occasional problems with their installations of JavaService, it can be useful to have a standard test tool application that can be loaded into a user environment. An initial version has been developed for investigation of one particular fault (a JVM was leaking memory when run as a service), but a clearer set of test software would be helpful. If you have, or wish to write, Java software of this sort then please do contact the team to see what may be the best route to take.
